introduction.title: Introduction to the Virtual Conference
content: The virtual conference covers topics related to AI, AI Product Owner, Engineering, and LLM Evaluation.
The conference features a diverse lineup of speakers including Jason Louie, Shrea Shanar, Dro, Cameron Wolf, Lauren Lockridge, Tunji, Golden, Kai, Fison, and Jerry Louie.
Apara, the founder of Arise AI, will be a keynote speaker and discuss her work in the evaluation space, particularly in the LLM evaluation space.
The conference will also touch on hot takes and finetuning in the traditional ML and AI engineering fields.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to the Virtual Conference
content: The virtual conference is a two-day event featuring experts in AI, AI Product Owner, Engineering, and LLM Evaluation.
The conference aims to provide a platform for knowledge sharing and networking opportunities.
The lineup of speakers includes Jason Louie, Shrea Shanar, Dro, Cameron Wolf, Lauren Lockridge, Tunji, Golden, Kai, Fison, and Jerry Louie.
Apara, the founder of Arise AI, will be a keynote speaker and discuss her work in the evaluation space, particularly in the LLM evaluation space.

sections.title: Section 2: AI Product Owner Track
content: The AI Product Owner track will focus on the product management aspect of AI and its impact on businesses.
Speakers will discuss the challenges and opportunities in AI product management, as well as best practices for successful AI product launches.
The track will also touch on ethical considerations in AI product development and management.
Topics covered in the AI Product Owner track will include AI product strategy, AI product roadmap, and AI product development methodologies.

sections.title: Section 3: Engineering Track
content: The Engineering track will focus on the technical aspects of AI and its implementation in various industries.
Speakers will discuss the latest trends and advancements in AI engineering, as well as best practices for building scalable and robust AI systems.
The track will also touch on AI security and privacy considerations, as well as the integration of AI in various industries such as healthcare, finance, and manufacturing.
Topics covered in the Engineering track will include AI model selection, AI model training, and AI model deployment.

sections.title: Section 4: LLM Evaluation Space
content: The LLM Evaluation Space will focus on the evaluation of large language models (LLMs) and their impact on various industries.
Speakers will discuss the challenges and opportunities in LLM evaluation, as well as best practices for building accurate and reliable LLM systems.
The track will also touch on the ethical considerations in LLM evaluation and the potential impact of LLMs on society.
Topics covered in the LLM Evaluation Space will include LLM evaluation metrics, LLM model selection, and LLM model training.

sections.title: Section 5: Hot Takes and Finetuning
content: The Hot Takes and Finetuning section will focus on the latest trends and advancements in AI and its impact on various industries.
Speakers will discuss the potential of AI in various industries, as well as the challenges and opportunities in AI finetuning.
The section will also touch on the ethical considerations in AI finetuning and the potential impact of AI on society.
Topics covered in the Hot Takes and Finetuning section will include AI finetuning techniques, AI finetuning for specific tasks, and AI finetuning for specific industries.
